intro: Colea concinna, commonly known as the slender corymbiferous plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly found in moist, shaded woodlands. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in corymbs. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Colea concinna is valued in horticulture for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in woodland gardens.
